titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (John D. 3rd) papers, Associates, John E. Harr papers
A Guide to the John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers, Associates, John E. Harr papers FA1219
titlestmt.author: Amy R. Fitch

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-05 00:26:56 -0500.

did.unittitle: John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers, Associates, John E. Harr

physdesc.extent: 35 letter-sized document boxes; 4 legal-sized document boxes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: These records document John E. Harr's tenure as associate to John D. Rockefeller 3rd, from 1967 to 1978. He worked on writing and research projects for Mr. Rockefeller, such as planning for his book on the future of philanthropy/the third sector in the United States.

In particular, Dr. Harr served as a proxy for Mr. Rockefeller on the National Committee for the Bicentennial Era in the years leading up to the 1976 Bicentennial celebration. The committee's extensive efforts are documented throughout this collection. Others topics of note are Mr. Rockefeller's activities regarding population growth, abortion, euthanasia, youth wellbeing, and public service. Lastly, this collection contains background material about Mr. Rockefeller's interests and activities in Asia that was aggregated by Dr. Harr and his co-author, Peter Johnson, for their two books on the Rockefeller family.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: John Ensor Harr worked as an associate of John D. Rockefeller 3rd from 1967 to 1978, focusing on research, writing, and public relations activities. He later served as vice president of Capital Cities/ABC Inc. as the project director of Project Literacy U.S. (PLUS). Dr. Harr held a doctorate in political science from the University of California, Berkeley, and was the author of several books on foreign affairs. Along with Peter Johnson, Dr. Harr co-authored two books on the Rockefeller family: "The Rockefeller Century" in 1988 and "The Rockefeller Conscience" in 1991. Born in 1926, John Harr attended Beloit College in Wisconsin, where he later served on the board of trustees. He died November 14, 2004.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has legal title, copyright, and literary rights to the collection in so far as it holds them. RAC has authority to grant permission to publish.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Harr files were transferred to RAC over the course of several years in the early to mid-1980s, including but not limited to accessions 1982:013 and 1985:172.
